intro: Capsella obtusa, commonly known as the bluntcatch or broadleaf catchfly, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, pink or white flowers. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and can be found in fields, roadsides, and waste areas. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Capsella obtusa is an annual herb that has been studied for its potential medicinal properties and ecological role in soil stabilization.
